comments.html:
Thanks a million -- forgot about that one.

While it's perfectly possible to implement anycast with OSPF (see https://blog.ipspace.net/2021/11/anycast-mpls.html), I always recommend running EBGP with servers. Added to the blog post.
comments.name: Ivan Pepelnjak

comments.html: Another situation where I would use BGP is when deploying anycast services (like anycasted DNS resolvers) in the network. You don't want to have those anycast nodes interfere with your IGP. BGP provides a nice separation of control/policy to keep mistakes from bringing down the network.
comments.name: Sander Steffann
